newsitem.title: GERMANY: D.Telekom declines comment on C&WC. [CORRECTED 14:20 GMT]
newsitem.headline: D.Telekom declines comment on C&WC. [CORRECTED 14:20 GMT]

text.p: Deutsche Telekom AG, the German telecommunications group, on Monday declined to commment on news reports that said it was negotiating to buy a 14 percent stake in Britain's Cable and Wireless Communications (corrects company name from Cable and Wireless Plc).
"Newspaper reports are speculation and we have the fundamental position that we do not comment on speculation," Telekom spokesman Hans Ehnert told Reuters.

According to a report in the Sunday Times of London, U.S. investment bank Goldman Sachs was advising Deutsche Telekom on the possble 750 million stg ($1.2 billion) purchase of a 14 percent stake in C&WC (corrects from C&W) from Bell Cablemedia Plc.
Telekom has made no secret in the past that it had spoken to Cable and Wireless since the British-based telecoms group bailed out of a German telecoms alliance with utilities Veba AG and RWE AG.
But the company has given no details of the talks and has not said whether it is interested in investing in C&W.
There has been speculation that C&W could join the Global One telecoms alliance between Deutsche Telekom, France Telecom and Sprint Corp of the United States.
Shares in C&W were up on in early trade in London, while Deutsche Telekom shares came under pressure, trading down 32 pfennigs at 36.77 marks at around 0925 GMT on computerised IBIS trade.
-- William Boston, Bonn Newsroom, 49 228 26097150 ($ = 0.624 British Pounds Sterling)
